body.p: offers support for a variety of Relational and Native XML database connections. includes a Database perspective that helps you to manage databases.

The database support in offers a variety of capabilities, including:
Browsing the structure of databases in the Data Source Explorer view.
Viewing relational tables in the Table Explorer view.
Executing SQL queries against databases.
Calling stored procedures with input and output parameters.
XQuery execution with databases.
Exporting data from databases to XML.

section.title: Relational Database Support
section.p:
Relational databases use a relational model and are based on tables linked by a common key. offers support for the most commonly used relational databases, including:
IBM DB2
Oracle 11g
Microsoft SQL Server
PostgreSQL
MySQL
also offers generic support (table browsing and execution of SQL queries) for any JDBC-compliant database (for example, MariaDB).

section.title: Native XML Database Support
section.p: Native XML databases have an XML-based internal model and their fundamental unit of storage is XML. They use XML as an interface to specify documents as tree structured data that may contain unstructured text, but on disk the data is stored as optimized binary files.
